definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
fart/flatulence/nonsense/(usu. in the negative) what/(not) a damn thing

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: What constitutes spanking in a family can vary widely.
sentences.chinese: 每个家庭打屁股的具体方式也很不一样。

sentences.english: Yet it's likely that the mothers in the study didn't consider spanking to be problematic behavior.
sentences.chinese: 很可能这些母亲并未意识到打屁股是有问题的。

sentences.english: As you grow older , you get more spanks.
sentences.chinese: 当你长大时，你被打屁股的次数也会增多。

sentences.english: They could threaten me with a spanking and I would surrender.
sentences.chinese: 她们可以用打屁股的方式威胁我，我会投降的。

sentences.english: He finally pulled the baby all the way out and held it upside down and slapped its bottom to make it cry.
sentences.chinese: 医生最终把孩子整个提了出来，头朝下打屁股让他哭。

sentences.english: My dear friends, is spanking a good way to discipline children?
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的朋友们，打屁股是教育儿童守纪律的好方法吗？

sentences.english: Do you think spanking is equal to child abuse ?
sentences.chinese: 你认为打屁股就等同于虐待儿童吗？

sentences.english: Do you agree that spanking is the most effective way to educate kids?
sentences.chinese: 你同不同意打屁股是教育孩子最有效的途径？

sentences.english: and I was like, "Since I got my spanking, can I have my tent now?"
sentences.chinese: 说“我都被打屁股了，现在可以要我的帐篷了吗？”

sentences.english: I think spanking is the only way to discipline a child.
sentences.chinese: 我认为打屁股是教育孩子的唯一的办法。

definition: to slap on the face/to box sb's ears
to suffer beating/fig. to be severely criticized/to take a hammering
to be beaten/to take a drubbing/buffeted/knocked about
to be made to stand still as a punishment
to take a beating/to get thrashed/to come under attack
to put in detention (a soldier, a pupil)
